questions.question: Solid wastes generally should not contain:
Which of the following is not a method of solid waste or refuse disposal?
questions.explanation: Oxidation ponds are not used for solid waste or refuse disposal. It is used for sewage treatment.Methods of solid waste disposal are:• Dumping•Controlled tipping• Incineration•CompostingManure pits• Burial

questions.question: Which of the following is the most insanitary method of waste disposal?
questions.explanation: The most insanitary method of waste disposal is dumping.Methods of waste disposal include:• Controlled tipping or sanitary landfill - Most satisfactory method of refuse disposal wheresuitable land is available• Incineration Method of choice where suitable land is not availableComposting• Manure pits• Burial• Dumping-

questions.question: Which method is most appropriate when suitable land for waste disposal is available?
questions.explanation: Controlled tipping is the most satisfactory method of refuse disposal when suitable land isavailable.In this method, waste materials are placed in a trench, compacted, and covered with earth at theend of the day. This method is also called a sanitary landfill. Chemical, bacteriological andphysical changes occur in the buried refuse with temperatures rising to over 60 degrees Celsiuswithin 7 days.Methods used for controlled tipping are:• Trench method615• Ramp method• Area methodSewage farming is also a method of sewage disposal in places where sufficient and suitable land isavailable. It is also called land treatment or broad irrigation.

questions.question: In controlled tipping, the amount of land required for the trench method to be practiced for apopulation of 10,000 is:
questions.explanation: In controlled tipping, one acre of land is required by the trench method to be practiced for apopulation of 10,000.It is also known as a sanitary landfill. It is the most satisfactory method of refuse disposal wheresuitable land is available. In this method, waste material is placed in a trench or other preparedarea. Then, it is adequately compacted and covered with earth at the end of the day.Methods used in controlled tipping are:••Trench method: Done in places where level ground is availableRamp method: Well suited where the terrain is moderately sloping• Area method: Used for filling land depressions, disused quarries, and clay pits

questions.question: Which of the following is false about composting?

options.A: Bangalore method is an aerobic process.
options.B: Mechanical composting uses a controlled environment
options.C: Nightsoil can also be disposed with composting
options.D: Compost has few or no disease-causing pathogens

questions.explanation: The Bangalore method of composting is an anaerobic process.Composting is a method of combined disposal of refuse and nightsoil. In this process, organicmatter is broken down into compost. It has manure value and few or no disease-causingpathogens.Bangalore method is an anaerobic method and is also called hot fermentationprocess. Trenches with a depth of not more than 90cm are used for this. This is done by spreadinga layer of refuse (15 cm thick) at the bottom of the trench and nightsoil (5cm thick) is added next.Layers of refuse and nightsoil are added alternatively till the heap rises to 30cm above groundlevel. The heap is then covered with excavated earth. At the end of 4 - 6 months, decompositionwill be completed.Mechanical composting is an aerobic process. In this method, compost is manufactured on a largescale by processing raw materials and turning out a finished product. The refuse is first cleared ofsalvageable materials. It is then pulverised to reduce the size of particles to less than 2 inches. Thepulverised refuse is then mixed with sewage, sludge or nightsoil in a rotating machine andincubated.

questions.question: Which of the following is the oldest non-service type of latrines in India?
questions.explanation: The oldest non-service type of latrines in India is the borehole latrine. It was introduced in the1930s to combat hookworm infections.Special equipment called auger is used to dig a borehole latrine.Advantages:• No special staff is needed for upkeep as after using the latrine is closed and another hole is dugelsewhere• Breeding of flies is less• No water pollution if located far from a water sourceDemerits:• Fills up rapidly•Augers are not readily available• Water pollution is still a risk618Borehole latrineCover slabMARROWDepth 5-10mOMARROWSolidaccumulation

questions.question: A health committee formed under Swachh Bharat Mission is involved in constructing septictanks in every household. Which of the following is true about a septic tank?
questions.explanation: The recommended retention period for a septic tank is 24 hours.If the retention period is too short, there is insufficient treatment of sewage and if it is too long,then undue septicity results.There are single and double-chambered septic tanks. The minimum capacity recommended for aseptic tank is 500 gallons. The depth of a septic tank is usually 1.5 to 2m.

questions.question: What is wastewater without human excreta called?
questions.explanation: Wastewater that doesn't contain human excreta is called sullage. It is also called greywater. E.g.,waste water from the kitchen.Sewage is wastewater from a community that contains solid and liquid excreta along with streetand yard washings. It is also called blackwater.

questions.question: What is the average amount of sewage which flows though the sewerage system in 24known as?
questions.explanation: The average amount of sewage which flows though the sewerage system in 24 hours is known asdry weather flow.

questions.question: Which of the following is not used to express the strength of sewage?
questions.explanation: E. coli count is not used to express the strength of sewage.The strength of sewage is expressed only in terms of:• Biochemical oxygen demand• Chemical oxygen demand•Suspended solids

questions.question: What does the biochemical oxygen demand of sewage indicate?
questions.explanation: Biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) indicates the organic content of sewage.620It is defined as the amount of oxygen absorbed by a sample of sewage for aerobic destruction byliving microorganisms.If wastewater contains toxic substances, the organic load is measured by the chemical oxygendemand.

questions.question: Which of the following values of biochemical oxygen demand would indicate that the sewageis weak?
questions.explanation: Sewage with biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) of 100mg/L would indicate that it is weak.If the BOD is ≥ 300 mg/L, sewage is said to be strong.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a part of the primary treatment of sewage?
questions.explanation: Aeration tank is not a part of primary treatment of sewage. It is a part of secondary treatment ofsewage.

questions.question: What is the function of the grit chamber in modern sewage treatment plants?

options.D: Allow anaerobic auto-digestion of organic matter

questions.explanation: The function of the grit chamber in modern sewage treatment plants is to allow heavierparticles in the sewage to settle.

questions.question: Trickling filter method is used in which of the following?
questions.explanation: The trickling filter method is used in secondary sewage treatment.

questions.question: Which of the following is the heart of the activated sludge process?
questions.explanation: The heart of the activated sludge process is the aeration tanks.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a requirement for an oxidation pond?
questions.explanation: Aeration is not a requirement for an oxidation pond.Oxidation ponds are also called waste stabilization ponds or redox ponds or sewage lagoons. Theyhave become a popular method of purifying sewage for small communities. It is usually an open,shallow pool of around 1 - 1.5m depth with an inlet and outlet.Requisites for an oxidation pond include:621•Algae• Saprophytic bacteria●SunlightAll of the above factors help in the treatment of sewage waste through aerobic and anaerobicprocesses. The effluent formed can be used for land irrigation or can be forwarded for furthertreatment.622
